title.narrative: 4.2 SOCIAL PROTECTION & PFM

description.narrative: By 2018, national partners and civil society have the capacity to manage child-sensitive public finances and respond adequately to child poverty and vulnerability through coordination, targeting and monitoring. and the evaluation of social protection measures, including social transfers, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2018, children, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from better support for their needs in targeting, public financial management, and social protection mechanisms.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, national partners and civil society have the capacity to manage child-sensitive public finances and respond adequatelyto child poverty and vulnerability through coordination, targeting and monitoring. and the evaluation of social protection measures, including social transfers

description.narrative: The Social Budget Observatory was supported to produce a report on social spending for the period 2013-2015, used to advocate with decision makers and Parliamentarians to increase spending toward achieving the 35% threshold recommended by IMF. A sector review in the area of Social Protection was conducted. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/08/2018
